description.en:
What Is Request (REQ)?
The Request (REQ) utility token, launched in 2017, ensures the performance and stability of the Request Network. The Request Network itself is an Ethereum-based decentralized payment system where anyone can request a payment and receive money through secure means. It removes the requirement for third parties in order to provide a cheaper, more secure payment solution that works with all global currencies.

When a user creates a request for payment, they define to which address the payment needs to be allocated and what the amount is. The user can also define the terms and conditions of the payment, upgrading a simple request into an invoice. Once this is completed, the user can share their request to be paid by their counterparty.

Every step is documented and stored on the Request network, allowing everyone involved to easily keep track of all the invoices and payments for accounting purposes.

Request is also integrated with legislation across the world to remain compliant with the trade laws of each individual country.

Who Are the Founders of Request?
The founders of Request are Christophe Lassuyt and Etienne Tatur.

Christophe Lassuyt is currently the chief financial officer at Request. Before this position, he co-founded MONEYTIS.

Etienne Tatur is the chief technical officer of Request. Prior to this, he also co-founded MONEYTIS and worked as a lead developer at QOBUZ, a music streaming service.

What Makes Request Unique?
The payments on Request are performed by simply sending an invoice through the blockchain; the counterparty can then detect the request and pay it with one click in a peer-to-peer manner. The fact that the payments are push-generated instead of pull-generated is one of Requestâ€™s key advantages. There is no need for users to share their account information. The use of blockchain technology also eliminates the need for third-party processors, resulting in a reduction in transaction costs.

The Request Network leverages decentralized blockchains such as Ethereum and IPFS for an increased level of security, privacy and data ownership for the end-user. The platform does have transaction fees, which is a cost that is required to broadcast a change to the blockchain network. The transaction fees are used to incentivize miners to reach consensus on the state of the network.

REQ can be stored on wallets such as Metamask, MyEtherWallet, Ledger, imToken, Trezor, Atomic Wallet, Jaxx Liberty and Trust Wallet.

How Many Request (REQ) Coins Are There in Circulation?
REQ is an ERC-20 token that can be spent to use the Request Network.

A portion of the REQ fee is burned at a rate that is determined by the current supply and the exchange rate with other currencies.

Requestâ€™s (REQ) circulating supply is at 999,912,165 REQ as of February 2021 and the maximum supply is 999,983,984 tokens.

How Is the Request Network Secured?
REQ is an ERC-20 token based on the Ethereum platform. The requests made with REQ are stored on an immutable digital ledger. This ledger also serves as proof for all auditing purposes.

Weâ€™re delighted to announce that the use of the Request Finance app has scaled with Fantom, which has been one of the fastest-growing protocols in the industry. Now supporting 15+ cryptocurrencies for invoicing & payments on Fantom.

REQ is now on Polygon, listed on QuickSwap, ApeSwap, and Uniswap


ðŸ‘‹ Request enthusiasts,

Weâ€™re pleased to announce that REQ is available on the Polygon network. This makes transactions easier and cheaper.

Moreover, you can now trade REQ on QuickSwap, ApeSwap, and Uniswap through the Polygon network. As of today, each exchange has the following liquidity pool provided:

ApeSwap: MATIC-REQ ($500k), wETH-REQ ($2M)

QuickSwap: USDT-REQ ($1M)

Uniswap: wETH-REQ ($300K)

Happy Monday to all!

We'd like to encourage you to vote for the most important feature, in your opinion. 

Feel free to go here and vote: https://snapshot.org/#/requestgovernance.eth/proposal/Qmc5yJwKSzrGzJTXfLt7ri2JPQLNGpzy5ksZFPC7e3wuaz  

More details: https://twitter.com/RequestNetwork/status/1386642630662967296

NEW: xDai and Request Partnership. Request becomes multi-chain with xDai Stable Chain 
https://request.network/en/2021/04/09/xdai-partnership/

If you miss out on last week's AMA with Request & Gnosis team, read the full transcript where we covered the Gnosis Safe product, its use case, future developments, and partnership with Request: https://request.network/en/2021/04/02/ama-gnosis/

We're thrilled to announce our partnership with NEAR Protocol to support and power transactions using the NEAR tokens.
More on our blog: https://request.network/en/2021/03/23/near-token-partnership/

Our latest product update is live: 
- Users can now attach files to a blockchain-based invoice. Crypto Invoices are now compliant and well documented.
-  The new users' experience has improved thanks to a smooth onboarding sign up process.
-  Request Invoicing App now supports both OCEAN and MPH tokens 
https://request.network/en/2021/03/15/new-in-request-attachments-onboarding-new-cryptos/
